Name: Providing age discrimination training to city agencies.
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to providing age discrimination training to city agencies.
BodyName: Committee on Civil and Human Rights

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights

History.BodyName: Committee on Civil and Human Rights

History.Description: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Civil and Human Rights

History.Description: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Civil and Human Rights

History.Description: This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
History.BodyName: Committee on Civil and Human Rights

History.Description: This Introduction was Amended by Committee
History.BodyName: Committee on Civil and Human Rights

History.Description: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
History.BodyName: Committee on Civil and Human Rights

History.Description: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor

Summary: This bill requires all City agencies to provide age discrimination training to their employees every two years. The training would be developed by the Department of Citywide Administrative Services and the Commission on Human Rights.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 35 of the New York city charter is amended by adding a new section 815.2 to read as follows:
      � 815.2. Age discrimination training. a. The department, in consultation with the commission on human rights, shall create training, including materials, to identify, prevent and eliminate age discrimination in the workplace. 
	b. The head of each agency, in consultation with the department, shall ensure that each employee of such agency receives age discrimination training biennially. Such training may be provided in combination with other training on equal employment provided to the agency's employees.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law.
      





NJC/BAM
LS 11312
11/10/2020
